title: Docs: OpenID Connect Client and Token Propagation Quickstart  guide
body:
### Describe the bug

I found few issues when trying tutorial https://quarkus.io/guides/security-openid-connect-client

1. [Keycloak config section](https://quarkus.io/guides/security-openid-connect-client#starting-and-configuring-the-keycloak-server) states "Make sure to put the realm configuration file on the classpath (target/classes directory)" How should I do that? This should be a step by step tutorial for people who are not familiar with this technology (and possibly not even with quarkus or maven). Is it enough to just put the `quarkus-realm.json` is resources dir? In the [complete sollution](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus-quickstarts/tree/main/security-openid-connect-quickstart) I found this file in separate `config` dir + setting up this dir in pom.xml, is it necessary?
2. Steps about starting the docker in the [Keycloak config section](https://quarkus.io/guides/security-openid-connect-client#starting-and-configuring-the-keycloak-server) should IMHO be moved after the [Running application in Dev mode](https://quarkus.io/guides/security-openid-connect-client#keycloak-dev-mode) section as running docker image is not required for dev section but it is for next ones. Currently it is confusing when the docker image should be running.
3. Keycloak docker-image version in  [Keycloak config section](https://quarkus.io/guides/security-openid-connect-client#starting-and-configuring-the-keycloak-server) should be updated. Is says that keycloak should be in version 17+, but currently 23.0 is out.
4. In [Running the application in Dev mode](https://quarkus.io/guides/security-openid-connect-client#keycloak-dev-mode) Steps about Dev UI should be updated for Dev UI 2. There are slightly different buttons and their names.
